GSD.description: Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to ping floods, potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker sends continual pings to an HTTP/2 peer, causing the peer to build an internal queue of responses. Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU, memory, or both.

CVE_data_meta.TITLE: Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to ping floods, potentially leading to a denial of service

credit.value: Thanks to Jonathan Looney of Netflix for reporting this vulnerability.

Depending on how efficiently this data is queued, this can consume excess CPU, memory, or both.
